content:
Check:
  any:
    - all:
        - name: CLDTC
          operator: non_empty
        - name: USUBJID
          operator: non_empty
        - name: CLORRES
          operator: is_not_unique_set
          value:
            - USUBJID
            - CLDTC
    - all:
        - name: CLDTC
          operator: non_empty
        - name: POOLID
          operator: non_empty
        - name: CLORRES
          operator: is_not_unique_set
          value:
            - POOLID
            - CLDTC
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.156
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when there is more than one record present for any particular
  Result or Findings as Collected, in the CL Domain, for a subject or pool on a particular
  date.
#The check for this rule was revised to NOT check the records where CLDTC is null
Outcome:
  Message: The Clinical Observation test result is not unique for this subject and
    date/time.
  Output Variables:
    - USUBJID
    - POOLID
    - CLTESTCD
    - CLORRES
    - CLDTC
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '156'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: One record per finding per observation time per subject
                  or pool
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.2.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - CL

json.Description: Raise an error when there is more than one record present for any particular Result or Findings as Collected, in the CL Domain, for a subject or pool on a particular date.

Outcome.Message: The Clinical Observation test result is not unique for this subject and date/time.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: One record per finding per observation time per subject or pool
